Class Driver

java.lang.Object
  Driver

public class Driver
extends java.lang.Object

This class is the driver program for Homework 3 of CMP-338 in the Spring 2015 semester.

Author:
Sameh Fakhouri

Driver

public Driver()
Method Detail

initializeTestList

public static ListInterface initializeTestList(ListInterface testList,
                                               int firstNumber,
                                               int lastNumber,
                                               int increment)
This method is called by the createTestList() method to initialize the test list. The test list could either be an ArrayList or a LinkedList. In either case, it will implement the ListInterface.

Parameters:
testList - The testList to be initialized.
firstNumber - The first number to be added to the list.
lastNumber - The last number to be added to the list
increment - The increment to be used by the for loop for each iteration. If the increment is zero, the test list is left empty.
Returns:
The initialized test list.
See Also:
createTestList()

createTestList

public static ListInterface createTestList(Driver.ListTypes listType,
                                           int firstNumber,
                                           int lastNumber,
                                           int increment)
This method is called by the runTestCase() method to obtain a test list. The test list could either be an ArrayList or a LinkedList. In either case, it will implement the ListInterface.

Parameters:
listType - The type of list needed. This can either be an ArrayList or a LinkedList.
firstNumber - The first number to be added to the list.
lastNumber - The last number to be added to the list
increment - The increment to be used by the for loop for each iteration. If the increment is zero, the test list is left empty.
Returns:
The created and initialized test list.

showList

public static void showList(ListInterface li)
This method is called to display the contents of the test list. The test list could either be an ArrayList or a LinkedList. In either case, it will implement the ListInterface.

Parameters:
li - The test list that should be displayed.

showHeader

public static void showHeader(java.lang.String title)
This method is called by the various test case methods to display the header for the test case along with the column titles for the run time measurements.

Parameters:
title - A String containing the description of the test case.

memoryUsage

public static double memoryUsage()
This method is used to calculate the amount of memory being used in the JVM currently.

Returns:
a double representing the amount of memory in kilobytes currently allocated in the JVM.

runDone

public static boolean runDone(int runCurrentNumber,
                              int runLastNumber,
                              int runIncrement)
This method is called by the runTestCase() method to check for the end of condition of the for loop.

Parameters:
runCurrentNumber - The current loop counter variable
runLastNumber - The end number for the for loop
runIncrement - The increment of the for loop. If the increment is positive, the method checks for runCurrentNumber > runLastNumber. If the increment is negative, the method checks for runCurrentNumber < runLastNumber.
Returns:
true if for loop should end, or false if the for loop should continue.

runTestCase

public static void runTestCase(Driver.TestTypes testType,
                               int initFirstNumber,
                               int initLastNumber,
                               int initIncrement,
                               int runFirstNumber,
                               int runLastNumber,
                               int runIncrement)
This method is called by the various test methods to run a particular test case. The type of test and its specifics are all specified by the parameters.

Parameters:
testType - The type of test case being run. The choices are:
  1. AddSorted
  2. Add
  3. AddWithIndex
  4. RemoveWithIndex
initFirstNumber - When creating a new test list, this parameter specifies the first number to start populating the test list with.
initLastNumber - When creating a new test list, this parameter specifies the last number to populate the test list with.
initIncrement - The increment to be used by the for loop for each iteration. If the increment is zero, the test list is left empty.
runFirstNumber - When running the test case, this parameter specifies the first number used by the test case.
runLastNumber - When running the test case, this parameter specifies the last number used by the test case.
runIncrement - When running the test case, this parameter specifies the increment used for the for loop.

addSortedOddNumbers

public static void addSortedOddNumbers()
This test case is for inserting all the odd numbers into an empty list. The odd numbers are added using the addSorted(Object obj) method of the ListInterface.

addSortedEvenNumbers

public static void addSortedEvenNumbers()
This test case is for inserting all the even numbers into a list containing only odd numbers. The even numbers are added using the addSorted(Object obj) method of the ListInterface.

add

public static void add()
This test case is for inserting all the numbers into an empty list. The numbers are added using the add(Object obj) method of the ListInterface.

addWithIndex

public static void addWithIndex()
This test case is for inserting all the numbers into an empty list. The numbers are added using the add(Object obj, int index) method of the ListInterface.

removeEvenNumbers

public static void removeEvenNumbers()
This test case is for removing all the even numbers from a list containing all the numbers. The numbers are removed starting with the smallest even number and using the removeObject(int index) method of the ListInterface.

removeOddNumbers

public static void removeOddNumbers()
This test case is for removing all the odd numbers from a list containing all the numbers. The numbers are removed starting with the largest odd number and using the removeObject(int index) method of the ListInterface.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
The main method executes all the test cases.
